oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Early US Claim by Rafe Ellkins for damages by Confederates
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Losses of 100 bushels of corn, 100 dozen sheaf oats, and 1000 bundles of fodder worth $76.66 taken by Gen. James Longstreet's Confederate forces from Rafe Ellkins of Hawkins County. There are approximately 100 of these Civil War US Claims in the Hawkins County Archives (microfilmed by TSLA). This claim was adjudicated under a state "Act to Secure to the Loyal Citizens of Tennessee, Recompense from the US Government for Losses Incurred by the Rebellion" passed by the General assembly on Feb. 19, 1863.
